bibl.title: Letter from J.N. Armstrong to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, May 26, 1913

div1.p: Armstrong requests biographical material on her son, Jesse Lazear, for a college reunion event.

div1.head: Letter from J.N. Armstrong to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, May 26, 1913
div1.opener:
Blairstown, N.J.
May 26th. 13
Mrs. C. C. Sweitzer,
Walbrook, Baltimore, Md.
My dear Madam:-
div1.p:
Your son Jesse was my class-mate for
the time he was at Washington & Jefferson College-the class of '88.

We are to hold our 25th. reunion at the College June 17th. in
connexion with commencement.
I have been appointed historian for the occasion.

Will you kindly supply me material so that I may tell about
Jesse's history from college days to the time of his heroic death?
I know some facts- but I wish more. I know much has been published.

Any printed matter you can send me, or loan me, will be greatly
appreciated. Or, if you will direct me to magazine articles, I
may be able to secure them somewhere.

You will greatly oblige by answering at your earliest
convenience.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, J. N. Armstrong.
P.S. I met you, I think, at Miss Hannah McKee's in Washington, Pa.
